title: MBTA Wiki
description: A guide to the public transit system in Massachusetts. On this site, you will find information about every station in the network, line alerts, and live predictions to make commuting easier.

title: MBTA Wiki iOS App
description: The mobile app version of MBTA Wiki. All the same features and more for easy commuting. Save stations as favorites for quick access, see live predictions on your phone, and more!

title: Portfolio site
description: You're on it! This was just a quick project to display some of my other projects and have a nice "internet home." It's very cozy in here :)

title: AP Score Distributions
description: View score distributions for College Board's AP tests for 2020 and the past few years. See how difficult this year's tests were compared to previous years.

title: Gerrymander Me!
description: A little game to demonstrate the dangers of letting politians decide voting districts. You work for a political party and try to make them win the election without a majority of voters.

title: LHS Block Calendar Generator
description: A Java program to make an .ics calendar file for my school schedule.

title: APUSH Crypto-Quote Decipher Tool
description: A Java program to help me decipher the extra-credit "crypto-quotes" for my AP U.S. History class. Yes, seriously.

title: PolyPack
description: A program for TI-84 Plus CE calculators to work with polynomials. Functions include a linear divider, a polynomial divider, and a factorer.

title: Fractals
description: My final project for AP Computer Science A I made with a friend. The program renders 3D fractals and lets the user explore them. Also generates really cool backgrounds.

title: Auto Scheduler
description: An automated script to schedule church service volunteers for me. I got tired of doing it manually, okay?

title: MineControl
description: A project I made with a couple friends for the MIT Blueprint 2019 hackathon to control Minecraft with an external circuit.

title: Integer Sines
description: A very small project to brute-force a curiosity I had. The question I was wondering was: the sine of which integer is closest to 1?

title: Sorting Visualizers
description: I liked the YouTube visualizations so much I tried to make my own version.

title: AI Battleship
description: A modified version of a lab for a computer programming intro course. I basically made a computer play Battleship with me.

title: Potato Run
description: A game I made a summer camp where you're a potato trying to run to a finish flag, dodging tomatoes. It has a... *unique* artstyle. I was in 5th grade, okay?

title: Speed Reading
description: A very old program of mine to see how fast I could read.

title: Countdown
description: Another old program of mine to show a countdown on the screen for a certain number of seconds.

title: Bubble Bounce
description: One of my first programs. It's me experimenting with Processing by making bubbles... bounce. It's a fun time.

title: C-Chat
description: The first program I ever made, now on the Internet for all to see. It's a chatting program for Windows users on the same network.
